content.html:
In this lesson, you will revisit the idea that not all systems of linear equations have a single solution. Next, you will investigate different ways to determine the number of solutions to a system of linear equations.

When you finish this lesson, you will be able to:

  • Determine how many solutions a system of equations could have.

Here are the activities that will help you reach those goals:

  • 2.6.1: Systems of Linear Equations with Infinitely Many Solutions
  • 2.6.2: Systems of Linear Equations with No Solution
  • 2.6.2: Self Check
  • 2.6.3: Sorting Systems of Equations Based on Number of Solutions
  • 2.6.3: Self Check
  • 2.6.4: Writing Consistent and Inconsistent Systems of Equations

After that, you’ll practice and review.

  • 2.6.5: Practice
  • 2.6.6: Lesson Summary
